What are some key features of the Verus protocol that enable users to create decentralized tokens and blockchains, and how do these features support DeFi capabilities?

The Verus protocol offers several key features that enable users to create decentralized tokens and blockchains, while also supporting DeFi capabilities.

**User-Created Tokens and Blockchains:**
One of the main features of Verus is that it allows any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged blockchain. This blockchain can be a multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. Additionally, these blockchains are 50% POW/50% POS, making them 51% hash attack resistant. All PBaaS (Private Blockchain as a Service) chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon.

**DeFi Capabilities:**
Verus also enables users to define DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers. This integration of DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols ensures smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities.

**Simultaneous Blockchain and Liquidity Pool Launches:**
Another key feature of Verus is the ability to launch a world-class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but are bound to the launch of the new blockchain and run on the new blockchain.

In summary, Verus provides a platform for users to create decentralized tokens and blockchains, while also supporting DeFi capabilities through its integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets. These features enable users to create complex, decentralized financial systems with ease.

All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
